description.narrative: The objectives of the Project are: (a) that a solid waste management system is established and that inhabitants on targeted islands use solid waste management facilities, reducing the risk of contamination associated with accumulated wastes and sea dumping; and (b) to build human and technical capacity for environmental management so that the environmental dimension is integrated in the plannng process using information and expertise developed in the Project.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement : Article 4.01 | Description :Effectiveness deadline is (90) days after the signature of the Financing Agreement| Due Date :03-Dec-2008

Finance Agreement : Schedule 2, Section IV, B 1(b) | Description :Category 2 withdrawals require satisfactory completion of (i)environ. and social impact assessment for the RWMF; and (ii) an operational and financial management framework for IWMCs and RWMFs| Due Date :31-Mar-2013

title.narrative: (a) Targeted islands are composting, separating recyclables & depositing residual waste in IWMCs; (b) targeted households pay user fees for waste mgmt; (c) no observed spillage in islands with IWMCs

target.value: (a) 50% of islands; (b) 50% of targeted households pay user fees for SWM; (c) 50% of islands

title.narrative: (a) Products & info on environmental issues from analyses made available for planning; (b) participation of island communities in assessment, M&E, stewardship of fisheries & coral reefs

target.value: (a) Relevant sector plans & ESIAs in the project atolls use project information; (b) 50% community participation rate

title.narrative: PDO 2: (a) Number of people enrolled in program as percentage of target
PDO 2: (b) Number of reports on terrestrial monitoring, marine monitoring and bait fisheries (Note: One of each except bait fisherywhere assessment is expected to conclude after 2 years)
PDO 1: (e)At least one RWMF built and operational (note: The feasibility study to be carried out during the first year of implementation will determine if more than one RWMF is needed)

target.value: One (1) facility for the entire implementation period

title.narrative: PDO 1: (d) At least one community member on each participating island successfully trained in SWM practices to manage the IWMC (note: Number of IWMPs depend on number of participating communities)
PDO 1: (f) Environmental impacts monitored and evaluated during RWMF construction and operation
PDO 1: (g) At least one barge/landing craft is procured and being used to transport waste to the RWMF(s)
PDO 1: (h) Waste accumulation does not exceed IWMC capacity in at least 50% of islands with IWMCs
PDO 1: (a) Community-based Island Waste Management Plans (IWMPs) developed on participating islands
PDO 1: (c) IWMCs built and operational on participating islands (Note: The number of centers to be built will be determined duringthe first year of implementation through a feasibility study)
PDO 1: (b) Island Waste Management Plans are implemented on participating islands
PDO 2: (c) Progress in community-based monitoring for each area (% of target islands participating)
Industrial and municipal waste disposal capacity created under the project
Number of agencies with direct access to NGIS data
